qas.question: Where did South Slavs and Germanic Gepids intermarried with Avar invaders?
In the Western Balkans, South Slavs and Germanic Gepids intermarried with who?
In Central Europe, the Slavs intermixed with who?
The eastern Slavs intermixed with who?
Scandinavians (Varangians) and Finnic peoples were involved in the early formation of what state?
What is another name for the Finnic peoples?
What state did the Germanic Gepids help form?
How many Romano-Dacians were there in the Magyar migration?
What attacking tribes lived in the regions of the north?

context: <a0_0>In the Western Balkans<a0_0/>, South Slavs and Germanic Gepids intermarried with <a1_0>Avar invaders<a1_0/>, eventually producing a Slavicized population.[citation needed] In Central Europe, the Slavs intermixed with <a2_0>Germanic and Celtic<a2_0/>, while the eastern Slavs encountered <a3_0>Uralic and Scandinavian peoples<a3_0/>. Scandinavians (<b5_0>Varangians<b5_0/>) and Finnic peoples were involved in the early formation of <a4_0><b6_0>the Rus'<b6_0/> state<a4_0/> but were completely Slavicized after a century. Some Finno-Ugric tribes in the north were also absorbed into the expanding Rus population. At the time of the Magyar migration, the present-day Hungary was inhabited by Slavs, numbering about <b8_0>200,000<b8_0/>, and by Romano-Dacians who were either assimilated or enslaved by the Magyars. In the <b7_0>11th and 12th centuries<b7_0/>, constant incursions by nomadic <b9_0>Turkic<b9_0/> tribes, such as the Kipchaks and the Pechenegs, caused a massive migration of East Slavic populations to the safer, heavily forested regions of the north. In the Middle Ages, groups of Saxon ore miners settled in medieval Bosnia, Serbia and Bulgaria where they were Slavicized.
